intro: Corchorus linearis, commonly known as common jute, is a flowering plant native to Asia and parts of Africa. It is a member of the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its linear, grass-like leaves and tall, branched stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are typically green or yellowish. Its fibrous stalks are harvested for their strong, durable fibers, which are used in the production of textiles and paper. The plant thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
